content: --क्षेत्रं <ab>N.</ab> of an extensive plain near Delhi, the scene of the great war between the Kauravas and Pāṇḍavas; धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः <ls>Bg. 1. 1</ls>; <ls>Ms. 2. 19.</ls>

कुरुक्षेत्र <ab>N.</ab> of an extensive region or plain near Delhi; the scene of the great war between the Pāṇḍavas and Kauravas. It is the tract near the holy lake called by the same name lying to the south of Thāneshvar, and extended from the south of the Sarasvatī to the north of the Dṛṣadvatī. It is sometimes called समंतपंचक the tract of the ‘five pools’ of blood of the Kṣatriyas slain by Paraśurāma.
